,,Bi-Bi-Si“ o Sejdubi Sumi: Od fristajlera u Gvineji, do ,,Old traforda“
07 Nov 2019, 10:39 by Nemanja
Britanski ,,Bi-Bi-Si“ objavio je tekst koji opisuje početak fudbalske karijere sadašnjeg igrača Partizana Sejdube Sume uoči utakmice sa Mančester junajtedom u Ligi Evrope.
Gvinejac je već deceniju u Evropi u koju je došao iz rodne zemlje i sa kojom je nastupao na Afričkom kupu nacija. Danas, igraće duel na kultnom ,,Old trafordu“, ali put do jednog od istorijski najvećih stadiona na svetu, nikako nije bio lak.
To je najbolje opisao bivši vlasnik južnoafričke ekipe Ajaks Kejp Taun – Džon Komitis, kada je ekipa doputovala u gvinejski Konakri na gostovanje Felo Staru u tamošnjoj Ligi šampiona.
 – Iza gola gde smo trenirali dan pre utakmice bio je jedan dečak koji je žonglirao tenisku lopticu. Ne šalim se kada kažem da za pola sata njegovog žongliranja, loptica nije pala više od tri puta na zemlju. Koristio je levu, desnu nogu, koleno, leđa, glavu…Nisam mogao da verujem. Gordon Igesund (prim.aut trener prvog tima) mi je prišao i upitao gledam li ovog klinca. Odgovorio sam mu: ,,Da, možeš li da veruješ?“. Pozvali smo ga odmah kod nas – objasnio je Komitis, te nastavio:
 – Bio je stidljivi dvanaestogodišnjak. Pitali smo ga može li to da ponovi sa velikom loptom, dali smo mu je i on je uradio isto. Bilo je magično. Naši igrači su stajali pored i podržavali ga, a mi smo ga samo pitali može li da igra, na šta je on odgovorio da može – rekao je Komitis.
Papirologija je usporila njegov odlazak u Kejp Taun, pa je tako Suma stigao sa 14 godina u Južnu Afriku. Kako prepričava Komitis, već nakon prvog treninga sa ekipom do 15 godina, prekomandovan je u tim do 17. Dolaskom turskog trenera Mušina Ertrugala, Suma nije dobijao šansu u prvom timu, jer je Turčin smatrao da ne radi dovoljno bez lopte, pa je imao sporadičnu ulogu.
Ubrzo nakon toga, usledio je njegov odlazak u Evropu, tj. u slovačku Nitru, da bi potom prešao u Slovan iz Bratislave, gde je bio i najbolji igrač.
Suma je najskuplje pojačanje u istoriji Partizana, ali nije se najbolje snašao u redovima crno-belih, da bi nakon pozajmica, ove sezone zaigrao znatno bolje, a upravo je protiv Junajteda pružio veoma dobru partiju u Beogradu pre dve nedelje.

BBC News on Sayduba Sumi: From Guinea Freestylers to Old Trafford
07 Nov 2019, 10:39 by Nemanja
The British BBC has published a text describing the start of the footballing career of current Partizan player Seiduba Suma ahead of the match with Manchester United in the Europa League.
The Guinean has been in Europe for a decade, to which he came from his native land and with whom he has performed at the African Cup of Nations. Today, he will play a duel at the iconic Old Trafford, but the road to one of the world's largest stadiums has never been easy.
This was best described by former Ajax Cape Town owner John Comitis when the team traveled to Guinea's Conakry to host Felo Star in the Champions League there.
- Behind the goal where we practiced the day before the game was a boy juggling a tennis ball. I’m not kidding when I say that in half an hour of his juggling, the ball didn’t fall more than three times to the ground. He used his left, right leg, knee, back, head ... I couldn't believe it. Gordon Igesund (prim.aut first-team coach) approached me and asked if I was watching this kid. I said to him, "Yes, can you believe that?" We called him immediately with us - explained Komitis, and continued:
- He was a shy 12-year-old. We asked him if he could repeat it with a big ball, we gave it to him and he did the same. It was magical. Our players stood by and supported him, and we just asked him if he could play, to which he replied that he could - said Komitis.
Paperwork slowed down his departure to Cape Town, and so Suma arrived at the age of 14 in South Africa. According to Komitis, after the first training with the team up to 15 years, he was promoted to the team until 17. With the arrival of Turkish coach Mushin Ertrugal, Suma did not get a chance in the first team, because Turk believed he was not doing enough without the ball, so he had sporadic role.
Shortly afterwards, his departure for Europe followed. to Slovak Nitra, then moved to Slovan from Bratislava, where he was also the best player.
The sum is the most expensive reinforcement in Partizan history, but he did not do well in the black and white to play much better after the loan, and he played a very good game against United two weeks ago against United.
